description: [English Version] Updated on 2024.05.22, optimized the display of key metrics. Rebuilt using Grafana10's new style, added the concept of health scores, and added some charts for overall resource consumption information. Includes overall resource display and detailed resource charts: CPU, memory, disk, IO, network monitoring indicators. https://github.com/starsliao/TenSunS

panels.title: üè°Resource overview: Current JOB [$origin_prometheus: $job] Currently selected host [$show_name] Instance: $instance

panels.description: Partition usage, disk read, disk write, download bandwidth, upload bandwidth. If there are multiple network cards or partitions, it collects the values of the network card or partition with the highest usage. Connections: CurrEstab - the number of TCP connections currently in the ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT state. Health value is a new indicator, calculated based on CPU, memory, and IO usage. A score below 90 indicates that system resource usage needs attention. This is a test indicator, and parameters may need optimization based on actual conditions.
panels.title: Server Resource Overview Table [Total Hosts: $total]

panels.description: - P99: The dataset is sorted in ascending order, and the data at the 99th percentile position is the largest data (i.e., the data at the 99% position after sorting in ascending order). This table requires adding recording rules in Prometheus (refer to the dashboard download page). There will be displayed data one hour after adding the recording rules. The time range [7d:1h] indicates viewing data points per hour for the past 7 days.
panels.title: P99 Resource Usage in the Last 7 Days
Overall Total Load and Overall Average CPU Usage
Overall Total Memory and Overall Average Memory Usage
Overall Total Disk and Overall Average Disk Usage

panels.description:
In this dashboard: total disk, usage, available, usage rate consistent with the 'Size', 'Used', 'Avail', 'Use%' columns of the df command, and the 'Use%' will be rounded to one decimal place for more accuracy.

Note: df 'Use%' calculation is: (size - free) * 100 / (avail + (size - free)), if the result is an integer, it's that value, if not, it's that value +1, unit is %.
Refer to df command source code:
panels.title: „Äê$show_name„ÄëÔºöPartition free space(EXT.*/XFS/NFS)
File Descriptors (FD) / Context Switches per Second

panels.description:
Read time seconds: Time spent on read operations per disk partition.

Write time seconds: Time spent on write operations per disk partition.

IO time seconds: Time spent on input/output operations per disk partition.

IO time weighted seconds: Weighted time spent on input/output operations per disk partition.
panels.title: Time Spent on Each IO Read/Write (Reference: less than 100ms)

panels.description:
Reads completed: Number of read completions per second for each disk partition.

Writes completed: Number of write completions per second for each disk partition.

IO now: Number of input/output requests being processed per second for each disk partition.
panels.title: Disk Read/Write Rates (IOPS)

panels.description:
Read bytes: Number of bytes read per second for each disk partition.

Written bytes: Number of bytes written per second for each disk partition.
panels.title: Disk Read/Write Throughput per Second

panels.description:
Time spent on I/O operations within each second of real time (wall-clock time).

node_disk_io_time_seconds_total:
The total number of seconds spent on input/output operations for the disk. This is an accumulating value. (Milliseconds Spent Doing I/Os)

irate(node_disk_io_time_seconds_total[1m]):
Calculates the rate per second: (last value - previous last value) / time difference, i.e., the proportion of time spent on I/O operations within one second.

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Proportion of Time Spent on I/O Operations

panels.title: Proportion of Time Spent on I/O Operations per Second (I/O Utilization)

panels.description:
Sockets_used - Total number of sockets used for all protocols

CurrEstab - Current TCP connections in the ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT state

TCP_alloc - Number of allocated TCP sockets (established and in sk_buff)

TCP_tw - TCP connections waiting to close

UDP_inuse - Number of UDP sockets in use

RetransSegs - Number of TCP retransmitted segments

OutSegs - Number of TCP segments sent

InSegs - Number of TCP segments received

properties.value: Total number of sockets used for all protocols

panels.title: Network Socket Connection Information

title: Node Exporter Dashboard 20240520 General JOB Group Edition ENG
